bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Earl and Sylvia Price were members of the Communist Party USA in New York City who were expelled in the latter 1940s because they held that the CPUSA, although it had expelled its "revisionist" leader Earl Browder in 1945, had not thereafter become sufficiently radical and militant.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This unprocessed collection contains materials created by various groupings of former members of the Communist Party USA who were expelled for their "excessive" radicalism in the years following World War II.
Box 2: Rosenberg Case -- criticism of CP role, clips
Box 3: Activities, writings, serials from Prices [removed?], other left-CP, 1940s-1960s
Box 4: David Mitchell [anti-draft resister]; anti-civil defense; early opposition to nuclear plants
Box 5: Turning Point corresp; Paul Robeson CP club; NY, other left-CP efforts in the US
